content: squishy soft cowl with a modification table for other sizes and yarn weights by jill june studiojuneyarn@sbcglobal net this is a very easy very fast cowl that looks more complicated than it is makes a great gift yarn squishy soft chunky 1 skein about 120 yards needle size 11 circular 18 to 24 works great finished size approximately 30 inches in circumference and 6 inches tall the red cowl is a 30 cowl knit with one skein of squishy soft chunky in the colorway deep garnet using a size 11 needle and 87 cast on stitches the blue cowl is a 24 cowl knit with one skein of squishy soft chunky in the colorway ocean using a size 11 needle and 71 cast on stitches please see table 1 on page 2 for suggestions on yarn substitution and size changes directions using a long tail cast on cast on 87 stitches join for working in the round be careful not to twist your work k4 p4 k4 p4…continue in pattern until about 3 yards remain bind off in purl enjoy  copyright studio june yarn october 25 2012 please do not make copies without written permission of the designer thanks  page 1 squishy soft cowl with a modification table for other sizes and yarn weights by jill june studiojuneyarn@sbcglobal net table 1 squishy soft chunky cowl - modification guide number of sti tches to cast on yarn weight needle size us 20 cowl 24 cowl 30 cowl chunky 11 63 71 87 worsted 8 or 9 79 87 119 light worsted or heavy dk 7 or 8 87 103 127 dk or heavy sport 6 or 7 99 119 149 chain ange pattern to k5 p5 sport 4 to 5 109 129 164 change pattern to k5 p5 fingering 3 or 4 119 143 179 change pattern to k6 p6 cowl measurements are approximate a nd indicate th e finished cir cumference o f the cowl this table is intended to be a guide gauge is not real important so feel free to substitute needle sizes to obtain a fabric you like gauge will affect the finished size of your cowl the table can help you determine the appropriate stitch count i tend to go up a needle size on cowls because i think it makes them drape more and feel softer important for something around your neck/face if you tend to knit tight i d suggest you go up a needle size for sure if you tend to knit loosely you may want to stick with the needle size that your yarn label recommends you will generally need 100 grams of yarn to complete a 24 cowl about 6 or 7 tall you can make the cowl taller or shorter to suit your taste and the amount of yarn you have on hand if you want a 30 cowl and you want it tallish you will need more than 100 grams 3 5 oz of yarn copyright studio
